text: The pathogenic agent of Middle East respiratory syndrome is a new coronavirus which was initially identified from the respiratory content of a patient who was infected, and died, as a result of infection from a mysterious viral disease showing pneumonia like symptoms in Saudi Arabia in 2012 [3] . Initially, a group of healthcare personnel working in a hospital in Jordan contracted a respiratory infection in April 2012, the source of which was not known [4] . Later in June 2012, an elderly businessman with severe pneumonia associated with kidney failure was admitted to a Saudi hospital. The coronavirus detected from his sputum was not known before and for a while [15] .
